node.title: All three men were convicted of murdering Ahmaud Arbery, but only one was convicted of ‘malice murder.’
node.description: In finding Travis McMichael guilty of that charge, the twelve jurors found that he had deliberately intended to kill Mr. Arbery.

node.title: Helicopters, Clipboards, Crew Cuts: The President Must Be in Town
node.description: President Biden and his family are spending Thanksgiving on Nantucket, renewing a family tradition that dates back to 1975.

node.title: Sweden's First Female Prime Minister Quits After Parliament Votes for Opposition Budget
node.description: Magdalena Andersson stepped down hours after taking office after her coalition government partner withdrew its support due to a budget defeat.

node.title: Biden Voters Who Went for Youngkin Say Democrats Focused Too Much on Social Issues
node.description: "They aren't hearing us talk about the economy enough," researchers said of Virginia voters following the state's gubernatorial election.

node.title: 50-Year-Old Gives Birth to 'Miracle Baby' After Years of Infertility Struggles
node.description: Susie Troxler said she didn't think there were options when she and her husband struggled to conceive naturally.

node.title: Los Angeles Launches Program to Divert 911 Calls Related to Homeless to Outreach Teams
node.description: The LAPD received about 140,000 calls related to the homeless per year. The new program will allow officers to respond to more crime-related calls.

node.title: With the 2023 World Cup around the corner, 23 young A-League Women's players are hoping to make their mark
node.description: As the 2023 Women's World Cup approaches, the upcoming A-League Women's season is a chance for young players to make their mark. So who are some of the competition's most exciting prospects?

node.title: Wild bilbies found outside park's fenced enclosure for first time in 70 years
node.description: The last time wild bilbies were recorded in Currawinya National Park in south-west Queensland was in the 1950s, but this team now believes there's "at least a couple" outside a pest-proof fence.

node.title: Quarantine hub contract's 'cloak of secrecy' exposed
node.description: The Queensland government is under fire for signing a confidentiality clause in the contract to build the 1,000-bed Wellcamp quarantine facility in the state's south.

node.title: COVID infections break pandemic records across Europe as fourth wave continues to wreak havoc
node.description: Europe is once again the epicentre of the coronavirus pandemic, prompting new curbs on movement and making health experts think again about booster vaccination shots.

node.title: What Does It Mean to ‘Yassify’ Anything?
node.description: A new Twitter account has amassed a following by sharing highly filtered versions of well-known images.

node.title: Criminal Trials Are Not Moral Reckonings
node.description: We must stop tying our hopes for justice to high-profile criminal cases.

node.title: Inflation worries dominated the Federal Reserve’s last meeting.
node.description: Some central bank officials suggested a quicker pace of tapering economic stimulus might be needed.

node.title: 'Sitting on Their Names Draws the Line': TikTok Shows Tourists Posing With 9/11 Memorial
node.description: "I would estimate every trip I make to the memorial, I see at least 10 people taking these types of photos within a two-hour window," the TikToker said.

node.title: Slide Hampton, Celebrated Trombonist, Composer and Arranger, Dies at 89
node.description: He began playing professionally as a child, worked with some of jazz’s biggest names in the late 1950s, and remained a leading figure in the music for the next 60 years.

node.title: Ahmaud Arbery Was Murdered. But His Life Will Not Be Forgotten.
node.description: We do not just remember the death. We remember the life, the beauty, the art, the feeling, the waiting, the living.

node.title: A Claim of Herd Immunity Reignites Debate Over U.K. Covid Policy
node.description: Neil Ferguson, a leading epidemiologist, said the country had almost reached a state of herd immunity as it settled into a new normal of about 40,000 cases a day. Other experts disagreed.

node.title: After 20 Months of Emergency Orders, Hawaii Will Start to Ease Some COVID Restrictions
node.description: Hawaii will end state-mandated capacity limits and distancing requirements for social gatherings as well as in restaurants, bars and gyms starting on December 1.

node.title: Ben Crump Says Guilty Verdicts in Arbery Case Not a Cause for Celebration but Reflection
node.description: "America, you raised your voices for Ahmaud. Now is not the time to let them quiet," the civil rights attorney said.

node.title: Al Sharpton Says Almost All-White Jury in Arbery Case Decided 'Black Lives Do Matter'
node.description: The three guilty verdicts against Travis McMichael, Greg McMichael and William "Roddie" Bryan were reached by a jury of 11 white jurors and one Black juror.

node.title: Broadway Actor, Michael Jackson Impersonator Arrested for Role in January 6 Insurrection
node.description: Broadway actor James Beeks was arrested for joining a group of 12 Oath Keepers members and helping them storm the Capitol on January 6.

node.title: Rapid Covid-19 tests could be widely used over summer holidays
node.description: Slip, slop, slap and swab could be the new summer checklist as the government prepares to roll out rapid Covid tests in holiday hot spots. Audio

node.title: Strong Winds May Force SoCal Power Company to Cut Power to Thousands Ahead of Thanksgiving
node.description: Southern California Edison said that 151,253 of their customers are currently under a power shutoff consideration.

node.title: How Much Prison Time Could the McMichaels, William Bryan Get After Ahmaud Arbery Verdict?
node.description: The men were found guilty in a Georgia court of multiple counts of murder in the 2020 killing of Ahmaud Arbery.

node.title: How a former Diamond plans to see more Indigenous netballers at the elite level
node.description: Former Australian Diamond, Sharon Finnan-White, creates a Queensland-based netball program as a pathway to the Super Netball competition for young Indigenous talent.

node.title: Malikah Shabazz, Daughter of Malcolm X, Is Found Dead in Brooklyn
node.description: Ms. Shabazz was found in her living room by her daughter on Monday. The police do not suspect foul play.

node.title: South Dakota High Court Won't Legalize Pot, Ruling Against 54 Percent Who Voted For It
node.description: Republican Governor Kristi Noem initiated a legal battle that concluded in the state's highest court on Wednesday.

node.title: 'Have a Nice Day, the Music's Going to Play': Viral Video Captures Argument With Neighbor
node.description: Opinions were split in the comments section of Reddit and TikTok over how the dispute was handled between the alleged neighbors.

node.title: Environmentalists OK With Tapping Oil Reserves, Say It Serves as Reminder of Clean Energy
node.description: President Joe Biden to use 50 million barrels of oil from America's strategic reserve in an attempt to lower the high gas prices across the country.

node.title: South Australian deputy premier vote to be held today, with two MPs vying for the title
node.description: South Australia will have a new deputy premier in place by the end of the day, with Lower House Liberal MPs to cast a vote in a secret ballot. So, who is in the running?
